key.name: avsync-support
key.summary: Determine if the clients can enable audio/video synchronization
key.description: Allows connected clients to enable audio/video synchronization. The valid values are 'enabled', 'disabled' or 'auto' (default='auto'). If 'auto' is specified, the audio/video synchronization is enabled only on console sessions and only if accelerated video compression is available.

key.name: buffer-time
key.summary: Audio injection buffer-time in msec
key.description: Sets the buffer-time in msec used into the virtual microphone audio injection. Default value 40 msec.

key.name: buffer-resync-interval
key.summary: Audio injection buffer resync interval in msec
key.description: Sets the interval to update the ideal and maximum audio buffer size used into the virtual microphone audio injection. Default value 10000 msec.

key.name: default-profile
key.summary: Default audio profile
key.description: Sets the default audio profile that must be chosen if it is available in the client.

key.name: frame-length
key.summary: Default audio samples frame-length in msec
key.description: Sets the default length in msec of audio samples used by grabber and injector. Default value 20 msec.

key.name: grab-device
key.summary: Grabbing device name
key.description: Specifies the grabbing device name. If empty audio grabbing will be disabled. If absent 'AWS Virtual Speakers 7.1' will be considered on Windows and the first 'pulse-monitor' device will considered on Linux.

key.name: grab-strategy
key.summary: The audio grabbing strategy
key.description: Specifies which API should be used for audio grabbing and whether the loopback feature of the API should be used to grab from a render devices. Allowed values include 'wasapi', 'wasapi-loopback' on Windows and 'pulse', 'pulse-monitor' on Linux. If absent the default value 'wasapi-loopback' on Windows and 'pulse' on Linux will be considered.

key.name: inject-device
key.summary: Injection device name
key.description: Specifies the injection device name. If empty audio injection will be disabled. If absent OS dependent default device name will be used: on windows 'DCV Microphone'.

key.name: silence-length
key.summary: Audio silence-length in msec
key.description: Sets the length in msec of the silence interval before stopping sending audio samples. Silence detection is disabled when 0. Default value 5 seconds.

key.name: source-channels
key.summary: Number of channels of the speaker device on Linux
key.description: Sets the number of channels of the Linux speaker device. The value must be less than or equal to the number of channels supported by the device. Allowed values are: 2 (stereo), 4 (4.0 quadriphonic), 6 (5.1 surround), 8 (7.1 surround). Default value is 2 (stereo).

key.name: codecs
key.summary: List of codecs for generic profile
key.description: Specifies the list of available audio encoding codecs available for the generic audio profile. They are sorted by preference.

key.name: bitrates
key.summary: List of bitrates
key.description: Specifies the list of available audio encoding bitrates (in kbps) available for the generic profile and codec Opus.

key.name: default-bitrate
key.summary: Default bitrate
key.description: Specifies the default bitrate for audio encoding. This value must be one of the available bitrates for generic profile.

key.name: bitrates
key.summary: List of bitrates
key.description: Specifies the list of the available bitrates (in kbps) for audio encoding on the generic profile and codec Raw. This is a "fake" bitrate because Raw doesn't have any encoding.

key.name: default-bitrate
key.summary: Default bitrate
key.description: Specifies the bitrate for the default audio encoding. This value must be one of the available bitrates for the generic profile and codec Raw. This is a "fake" bitrate because Raw doesn't have any encoding.

key.name: codecs
key.summary: List of codecs for profile Voice
key.description: Specifies the list of available audio encoding codecs for the voice profile. They are sorted by preference.

key.name: bitrates
key.summary: List of bitrates
key.description: Specifies the list of available audio encoding bitrates (in kbps) for the voice profile and codec Opus.

key.name: default-bitrate
key.summary: Default bitrate
key.description: Specifies the bitrate of the default audio encoding. This value must be one of the available bitrates for the voice profile.

key.name: clipboard-quirks
key.summary: Clipboard sharing quirks
key.description: Selects workarounds for clipboard sharing quirks. Allowed values are: 'allow-html-when-rtf-available' (HTML may include paths to local images so it is more safe to expose only RTF when it is available), 'primary-selection-paste' (enables the primary selection pasting on linux), 'primary-selection-copy' (enables the primary selection copy from linux). If this value is missing no flag is assigned.

key.name: disabled-targets
key.summary: Clipboard targets to be disabled
key.description: Specifies the clipboard target formats to be disabled. Accepted values are: 'dcv/text', 'dcv/image', 'dcv/rtf', 'dcv/html', 'dcv/raw' and any raw format string. Please note that disabling a cross platform target do not disables the corresponding raw targets. Default value: ['Biff5', 'Biff8', 'Biff12', 'CF_HDROP', 'Preferred DropEffect'].

key.name: ignore-events-targets
key.summary: Clipboard targets of update events to be ignored
key.description: Specifies the clipboard target formats of local and remote update events be ignored. Accepted values are: 'dcv/text', 'dcv/image', 'dcv/rtf', 'dcv/html', 'dcv/raw' and any raw format string. Default value: ['Shell IDList Array'].

key.name: enabled
key.summary: Whether the clipboard feature should be enabled
key.description: Specifies if the clipboard feature is enabled. If the clipboard feature is disabled, users will not be able to use the clipboard remotization. Clipboard monitoring will be disabled too.

key.name: primary-selection-copy
key.summary: Enable the primary selection copy from linux
key.description: Linux desktops support multiple clipboards: the generic clipboard and the primary selection. The primary selection is updated or copied when content is selected. It can then be pasted using the mouse's middle button or with the Shift+Insert key combination. When enabled, the primary selection is monitored and updates are propagated to the client.

key.name: max-image-area
key.summary: Maximum area of clipboard's image
key.description: Specifies the maximum area (number of pixels) of clipboard images that can be transferred between server and clients. If this value is missing or set to -1, the limit is not applied.

key.name: max-image-area-copy
key.summary: Maximum area of clipboard's image
key.description: Specifies the maximum area (number of pixels) of clipboard images that can be transferred from server to clients. If this value is missing max-image-area is considered, otherwise the minimum of the two values is applied.

key.name: max-image-area-paste
key.summary: Maximum area of clipboard's image
key.description: Specifies the maximum area (number of pixels) of clipboard images that can be transferred from clients to server. If this value is missing max-image-area is considered, otherwise the minimum of the two values is applied.

key.name: max-payload-size
key.summary: Maximum size of clipboard's data
key.description: Specifies the maximum size (in bytes) of clipboard data that can be transferred between server and clients. Maximum supported value 20 MB. If this value is missing, the maximum limit is enforced.

key.name: max-payload-size-copy
key.summary: Maximum size of clipboard's data
key.description: Specifies the maximum size (in bytes) of clipboard data that can be transferred from server to clients. If this value is missing max-payload-size is considered, otherwise the minimum of the two values is applied.

key.name: max-payload-size-paste
key.summary: Maximum size of clipboard's data
key.description: Specifies the maximum size (in bytes) of clipboard data that can be transferred from clients to server. If this value is missing max-payload-size is considered, otherwise the minimum of the two values is applied.

key.name: max-text-len
key.summary: Maximum number of characters of clipboard's text
key.description: Specifies the maximum number of characters of clipboard text that can be transferred from server to clients. Excess characters will be truncated. If this value is missing or set to -1, the limit is not applied.

key.name: max-text-len-copy
key.summary: Maximum number of characters of clipboard's text
key.description: Specifies the maximum number of characters of clipboard text that can be transferred from server to clients. Excess characters will be truncated. If this value is missing max-text-len is considered, otherwise the minimum of the two values is applied.

key.name: max-text-len-paste
key.summary: Maximum number of characters of clipboard's text
key.description: Specifies the maximum number of characters of clipboard text that can be transferred from clients to server. Excess characters will be truncated. If this value is missing max-text-len is considered, otherwise the minimum of the two values is applied.

key.name: primary-selection-paste
key.summary: Enable the primary selection pasting on linux
key.description: Linux desktops support multiple clipboards: the generic clipboard and the primary selection. The primary selection is updated or copied when content is selected. It can then be pasted using the mouse's middle button or the Shift+Insert key combination. When enabled, the client's clipboard content will be also inserted in the primary selection.

key.name: update-timeout
key.summary: Update event notification timeout
key.description: Specifies the time in msec to wait from the last update event for sending the notification to the client. Default value 200 msec.

key.name: congestion-control-strategy
key.summary: The congestion control strategy applied for UDP connections
key.description:
Specifies the congestion control strategy which shall be applied for QUIC connections.
Currently, the following values are supported (each value corresponds to a different strategy and they are mutually exclusive): - gcc: It uses an internal implementation of Google Congestion Control. - quic: It uses the congestion control from QUIC internal implementation. - none: It completely disables any form of congestion control.

key.name: disconnect-on-lock
key.summary: Whether the clients are disconnected on OS session lock
key.description: Enable this to force client disconnection when the remote OS session is locked. Otherwise clients will continue to stream the remote session. Currently supported only on console sessions. This parameter value is read at every remote OS session lock.

key.name: disconnect-on-logout
key.summary: Whether the clients are disconnected on OS user logout
key.description: Enable this to force client disconnection when the remote OS user is logged out (i.e. OS session is closed). Otherwise clients will continue to stream the remote session. Currently supported only on console sessions. This parameter value is read at every remote OS user logout.

key.name: dqt-alpn-versions
key.summary: Specify the DQT application versions meant to be used during connection establishment
key.description: Specifies a list of supported ALPN versions supported by server. During handshake with the client, the server will select the first available matching from the list, in order. Therefore, the list is ordered by version selection preferences. Currently, the following version values are supported: Dqt10, Dqt02Draft, Dqt01Draft, Dcv20Basic.

key.name: enable-quic-frontend
key.summary: Whether to enable the QUIC frontend
key.description: Specifies whether the QUIC frontend should be enabled.

key.name: enable-datagrams-audio
key.summary: Whether to enable usage of datagrams for audio playback.
key.description: Enabling this feature it allows sending audio playback data using datagrams. The feature is applicable only with QUIC transport. Accepted values are 'client-decides', 'always-on', 'always-off'. If the value for this setting is 'always-off', the server will use streams for audio playback. If the value is 'always-on', the server will use datagrams unless it's communicating with an old client that is not compatible with datagrams. If the value is 'client-decides', the server will use streams if the client advertises preference for streams through the use of downgraded ALPNs or feature flags.

key.name: enable-datagrams-display
key.summary: Whether to enable usage of datagrams for display.
key.description: Enabling this feature it allows sending display tile updates using datagrams. The feature is applicable only with QUIC transport. Accepted values are 'client-decides', 'always-on', 'always-off'. If the value for this setting is 'always-off', the server will use streams for the display. If the value is 'always-on', the server will use datagrams unless it's communicating with an old client that is not compatible with datagrams. If the value is 'client-decides', the server will use streams if the client advertises preference for streams through the use of downgraded ALPNs or feature flags.

key.name: enable-unreliable-input
key.summary: Whether to enable the unreliable transport for input data
key.description: Enabling this feature it allows communication over unreliable transport. The feature is applicable only with QUIC transport.

key.name: idle-timeout
key.summary: Idle timeout
key.description: Specifies the number of minutes to wait before disconnecting idle clients. Specify 0 to never disconnect idle clients. This parameter value is read every second.

key.name: idle-timeout-warning
key.summary: Idle timeout warning
key.description: Specifies the number of seconds relative to idle-timeout to wait before warning idle clients about idle timeout disconnection. Specify 0 to never warn idle clients.

key.name: min-target-bitrate
key.summary: Minimum target bitrate
key.description: Specifies the minimum target bitrate (in Kbps) for connections using QUIC transport. A zero value (default value) means 100 Kbps.

key.name: min-video-adaptive-bitrate-level
key.summary: Level of min bitrate adaptive to video content
key.description: This value is used to calculate the minimum bitrate adaptive to video content as the percentage of min adaptive bitrate provided by the encoder. If set to 0, the min adaptive bitrate is disabled. For instance, a value of 100 at 1920x1080@25 equals to 2 Mbps and 1920x1080@25 equals to 5 Mbps

key.name: max-target-bitrate
key.summary: Maximum target bitrate
key.description: Specifies the maximum target bitrate (in Kbps) for connections using QUIC transport. A zero value (default value) means 100 Mbps.

key.name: max-video-adaptive-bitrate-level
key.summary: Level of max bitrate adaptive to video content
key.description: This value is used to calculate the maximum bitrate adaptive to video content as the percentage of max adaptive bitrate provided by the encoder divided this value. If set to 0, the max adaptive bitrate is disabled. For instance, a value of 100 at 1920x1080@25 equals to 12.9 Mbps and 1920x1080@60 equals to 31 Mbps

key.name: quic-idle-timeout
key.summary: Quic idle timeout
key.description: Specifies the timeout (in seconds) after which quic connections are marked as idle. If set to 0, the idle timeout is not set.

key.name: quic-listen-endpoints
key.summary: Specify the endpoints over which DCV listens for incoming QUIC connections
key.description: Specifies a list of endpoints where DCV will listen for incoming QUIC connections. The endpoints can be a list of local bindable IPv4 addresses ('0.0.0.0' to wildcard all the possible addresses), or bindable IPv6 addresses ('::' to wildcard all the possible addresses) with an optional port separated by a colon (':'). For example, '1.2.3.4:5678' would listen for incoming connections on the interface associated with the '1.2.3.4' address, on port of 5678. If the port is not specified the setting in 'quic-port' will be used as a default. To specify a port with an IPv6 address, enclose the address in square brackets (e.g. '[::1]:8443'). IPv6 addresses including an explicit interface are also supported (e.g. '[::%eth1]:8443').

key.name: quic-port
key.summary: UDP port for the QUIC frontend
key.description: Specifies the UDP port on which the DCV server listens for client connections. The port number must be between 1024 and 65535. See the 'quic-listen-endpoints' setting for further details on how this setting is applied.

key.name: socket-timeout
key.summary: Socket timeout
key.description: Specifies the socket timeout (in seconds). If set to 0, the socket-timeout is not set.

key.name: target-bitrate
key.summary: Target bitrate
key.description: Specifies the target bitrate for connections using QUIC transport (in bps). If set to 0, the target bitrate provided by the congestion controller will be used.

key.name: web-extra-http-headers
key.summary: Set the array of extra headers to be added to the HTTP/HTTPS headers
key.description: Uses it to add extra headers. The array should be filled with couples like: [('header_name','header_content')]. Multiple headers can be added.

key.name: web-listen-endpoints
key.summary: Specify the endpoints over which DCV listens for incoming web connections
key.description: Specifies a list of endpoints where DCV will listen for incoming web connections. The endpoints can be a list of local bindable IPv4 addresses ('0.0.0.0' to wildcard all the possible addresses), or bindable IPv6 addresses ('::' to wildcard all the possible addresses) with an optional port separated by a colon (':'). For example, '1.2.3.4:5678' would listen for incoming connections on the interface associated with the '1.2.3.4' address, on port of 5678. If the port is not specified the setting in 'web-port' will be used as a default. To specify a port with an IPv6 address, enclose the address in square brackets (e.g. '[::1]:8443'). IPv6 addresses including an explicit interface are also supported (e.g. '[::%eth1]:8443').

key.name: web-port
key.summary: TCP port for the client
key.description: Specifies the TCP port on which the DCV server listens for client connections. The port number must be between 1024 and 65535. See the 'web-listen-endpoints' setting for further details on how this setting is applied.

key.name: web-root
key.summary: Document root for the embedded web server
key.description: Specifies the document root for the embedded web server.

key.name: web-url-path
key.summary: URL path for the embedded web server
key.description: Specifies the URL path for the embedded web server, must start with '/'. For example, setting it to /test/foo means that the web server is reachable at https://host:port/test/foo.

key.name: web-use-hsts
key.summary: Whether to use HSTS
key.description: Enables this to force browsers to prevent any communication being sent over HTTP. All transfer to the webpage (and all subdomains) will be done using HTTPS instead.

key.name: web-use-https
key.summary: Use TLS for the HTML5-based clients
key.description: Uses HTTPS and WSS for the embedded web server connections. This parameter should be set to false ONLY to debug problems. Using this option in production is insecure.

key.name: web-x-frame-options
key.summary: Set the X-Frame-Options value
key.description: The default value is set to DENY. If you change this, you must introduce another form of protection to avoid clickjacking attacks. If you do not have other protection, do not change this setting.

key.name: ws-keepalive-interval
key.summary: Websocket keepalive interval
key.description: Specifies the interval (in seconds) after which to send a keepalive message. If set to 0, the keepalive message is disabled.

key.name: ws-message-reception-timeout
key.summary: Maximum websocket message reception timeout
key.description: Specifies the maximum time without receiving websocket messages before considering the connection broken. If set to 0, the check is disabled.

key.name: allow-nvidia-vmonitor-init
key.summary: Whether to allow virtual monitor initialization with Nvidia adapters
key.description: Specifies whether to allow virtual monitor initialization with Nvidia adapters. If enabled, virtual monitors will be added during layout manager initialization in case there are no monitors detected.

key.name: apply-client-dpi
key.summary: Apply the dpi of the client
key.description: Applies the dpi of the client to the layout of the server if supported by the OS.

key.name: block-size
key.summary: Tile block size
key.description: Sets the minimum size of tiles used when processing the screen content. The setting is reloaded at each agent restart.

key.name: console-session-default-layout
key.summary: Default screen resolution and position for console sessions
key.description: Specifies the default screen resolution and position for console sessions. If this is set, DCV sets the requested layout at startup. Each monitor can be configured with resolution (w,h) and position (x,y). All specified monitors are enabled. Default layout example value: [{'w':<800>, 'h':<600>, 'x':<0>, 'y': <0>}, {'w':<1024>, 'h':<768>, 'x':<800>,'y':<0>}]

key.name: cuda-devices
key.summary: CUDA devices used for stream encoding
key.description: Specifies the list of local CUDA devices which DCV uses to distribute encoding and CUDA workloads. Each device is identified by a number that can be retrieved from the nvidia-smi command. For example, cuda-devices=['0', '2'] indicates that DCV uses two GPUs, with IDs 0 and 2. This setting is similar to the CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES environment variable, but it only applies to DCV. If the option is not set, DCV uses an incremental session index starting from 0 to pick the next device to use.

key.name: diffmap-refine-threshold
key.summary: Set threshold for diffmap refining
key.description: Diffmaps reported by the low-level grabber functions are refined only if the number of reported dirty blocks is bigger than this threshold. If this threshold is set to -1, the diffmap is not refined. If the threshold is set to 0, the diffmap is always refined. Only DTS and XCB grabbers currently support diffmap refining.

key.name: display-encoders
key.summary: Display encoders
key.description: Specifies the name of the display encoders to use. An empty list enables all display encoders. The display encoders are ['nvenc', 'amd', 'amf', 'vaapi', 'ffmpeg', 'turbojpeg', 'lz4'].

key.name: dynamic-diffmap-refine
key.summary: Enable or disable diffmap refinement depending on input framerate
key.description: Diffmaps reported by the low-level grabber functions are refined only if the estimated time to compute the refinement is negligible with respect to the total frame time (less than 1/10 of the frame time).

key.name: enable-client-resize
key.summary: Whether to allow clients to set the display layout
key.description: Specifies whether clients are allowed to set the display layout.

key.name: enable-layout-constraints
key.summary: Whether to enforce layout constraints
key.description: Enables or disables layout constraints enforcement when the server monitor layout changes. Each layout manager implementation will enforce different layout constraints depending on the environment requirements. Layout constraints are applied to monitor layout when it changes, regardless of the cause of the change. The constraints are i.e. enforced also when the change is not caused by DCV (e.g. if it is manually performed by the user or by another application).

key.name: enable-qu
key.summary: Whether to send quality updates
key.description: Specifies whether to send quality updates.

key.name: enable-yuv444-encoding
key.summary: Whether to enable YUV444 encoding
key.description: Enables or disables YUV444 encoding. If 'always-on' the server will prefer the YUV444 format that is optimized for high color accuracy. If 'always-off' the server will prefer a format that is optimized for streaming performance. The values 'default-on' and 'default-off' have the same semantics, which is to let the client decide. Allowed values: 'always-on', 'always-off', 'default-on', 'default-off'.

key.name: enable-window-tracking
key.summary: Enable window tracker
key.description: Enables window tracking and server will start the seamless service on client request.

key.name: encoding-mode
key.summary: Encoding mode used for unreliable streams
key.description: Controls the encoding mode used for unreliable streams. Allowed values: 'qp' (Quantization), 'cbr' (Constant Bit Rate), 'vbr' (Variable Bit Rate).

key.name: flow-controller
key.summary: Flow controller strategy to apply
key.description:
Specifies the flow controller strategy to be applied.
Currently, the following values are supported: `auto`, `fit`, `fit-precise`, `fit-precise-sync`, `time-window`, `time-window-sync`
The strategies are: - auto: Selects the best strategy according to DCV network configuration. - fit: Limits the number of frames in transit using the latency of the display channel to modulate between two threshold values. This is the only one supported on WebSocket protocol. - fit-precise: Limits the number of frames in transit using the transport measured RTT to modulate between two threshold values. This strategy is experimental and currently tested only to work with GPU instances at 60fps. If a gateway is in the connection and there is no RTT communication (for example because the gateway version is too old), it will fall-back to `fit`. - fit-precise-sync: Same as `fit-precise` but limits the emission of new frames if the network reports being flow-limited or congestion-limited. This strategy is experimental and currently tested only to work with GPU instances at 60fps. - time-window: Instead of limiting the number of frames-in-transit, it limits the maximum time gap with the oldest frame so that it nevers get higher than the transport measured RTT. If a gateway is in the connection and there is no RTT communication (for example because the gateway version is too old), it will fall-back to `fit`. This strategy is experimental, but should support CPU instances at lower fps. - time-window-sync: Same as `time-window`, but limits the emission of new frames if the network reports being flow-limited or congestion-limited. This strategy is experimental, but should support CPU instances at lower fps.

key.name: framebuffer-readers
key.summary: Framebuffer readers
key.description: Specifies the name of the framebuffer readers to use. An empty list enables all framebuffer readers. Windows framebuffer readers are ['idd', 'desktopduplication', 'gdi']. Linux framebuffer readers are ['nvfbc', 'xcb'].

key.name: frames-in-transit
key.summary: Default minimum and maximum frames in transit
key.description: Sets the allowed range for the number of frames that are sent over the wire before waiting for acknoledgement.

key.name: frame-queue-weights
key.summary: Display channel queue weights
key.description: Sets weights used for the different frame types to tune the display channel. If the provided value is (0,0,0), the frame-queue-weights parameters will be set to (5,3,1) in case hardware-accelerated encoding is present, and to (8,3,1) otherwise.

key.name: full-frame-threshold
key.summary: Set minimum threshold (percentage) for using full-frame encoder
key.description: Fullframe encoder is used if the percentage of reported dirty blocks is bigger than this threshold, otherwise the tile encoder is used. The first number is used if software encoding is in use, while the second is used if a hardware encoder is present.

key.name: grabber-target
key.summary: Grabber target
key.description: Controls memory residency and processing of the framebuffer reader buffers. Allowed values: 'system', 'gpu', 'auto'. 'system' means 'keep the buffers on system memory (RAM)'. 'gpu' means 'keep the buffers on GPU memory'. 'auto' will use 'gpu' if the machine supports it, otherwise it will fallback to 'system'. This setting is reloaded each time a new monitor is added. This setting has effect only if 'desktopduplication' framebuffer reader is used.

key.name: grabber-target-fps
key.summary: Target frames per second of frame grabber
key.description: Sets the upper limit to grab frames per second. A value of 0 defaults to the standard behavior of each specific frame buffer reader, e.g. fallback to target-fps or don't limit grabbing. Not all frame capture backends honor this setting.

key.name: layout-managers
key.summary: Display layout managers
key.description: Specifies the name of the layout managers to use. An empty list enables all layout managers. Windows layout managers are ['nvapi', 'virtualxddm', 'amd', 'dts', 'dod', 'winapi', 'idd']. Linux layout managers are ['xrandr'].

key.name: max-compressor-threads
key.summary: Max compressor threads
key.description: Specifies the maximum number of compressor threads.

key.name: max-head-resolution
key.summary: Max head resolution
key.description: Sets the maximum resolution of a display head requestable by the client. A display head is equivalent to a host monitor. The setting is reloaded at each client layout request. When a bigger head resolution is requested by a client, the server adjusts the resolution to make sure that it matches the maximum width and height values set by this option.

key.name: min-head-resolution
key.summary: Min head resolution
key.description: Sets the minimum resolution of a display head requestable by the client. A display head is equivalent to a host monitor. The setting is reloaded at each client layout request. When a smaller resolution is requested by a client, the server adjusts the resolution to make sure that it matches the minimum width and height values set by this option.

key.name: max-layout-area
key.summary: Max layout area in pixels
key.description: Sets the maximum area in pixels of a display layout requestable by the client. Layouts that are larger than this limit will be ignored. This maximum is meant to provide an upper bound to the amount of display data that must be sent, without providing constraints on the display layout geometry. If set to 0, no limit is applied to layout area. The setting is reloaded at each client layout request.

key.name: max-num-heads
key.summary: Max number of heads
key.description: Specifies the maximum number of display heads requestable by the client. A display head is equivalent to a host monitor. The setting is reloaded at each client layout request. When a greater number of heads is requested by a client, the server adjusts the number of heads so that the value does not exceed the value set by this option.

key.name: qu-bandwidth
key.summary: Bandwidth cap for quality updates
key.description: Specifies how much to fragment quality updates. A higher value means quality updates are less fragmented and complete faster, but could stall real updates. A value of 0 means no limit, so all unchanged parts of the screen are sent as quality updates. The value is specified in MBit.

key.name: quality
key.summary: Default minimum and maximum image quality
key.description: Specifies minimum and maximum limits for the image quality range. Use integers between 1 and 100.

key.name: quic-frames-in-transit
key.summary: Default minimum and maximum frames in transit for QUIC connection
key.description: Sets the allowed range for the number of frames that are in transit.

key.name: quic-incomplete-frame-slices
key.summary: Default number of constrained slices used for incomplete frames with QUIC connection
key.description: Sets the number of constrained slices used to encode the frame. In this way, individual slices may be dropped by quic transport in place of the entire frame. When a slice is dropped, the relative region is blocked until the frame is recovered. If this value is 0, only the entire frame can be dropped and the number of not-contrained slices is used instead. This value is considered only if constrained encoding is supported by the video encoder.

key.name: quic-persistent-frames
key.summary: Default number of persistent video frames to update static regions with QUIC connection
key.description: Sets the number of persistent frames to define image quality even if the image content doesn't change between frames. Static areas are encoded multiple times to let the h.264 stream define the image quality over time. With UDP transport, the video bitrate may be decreased to control network congestion. Persistent frames can be used to reduce the differencies in image quality between h.264 and lossless QUs, in particular when the video quality is low. Note that high values of persistent frames may shadow actual QUs.

key.name: quic-constant-framerate
key.summary: Force framerate to be always equals to target fps
key.description: Enable persistent frames and use them to produce the exact number of frames per second suggested by target fps. If the desktop screen doesn't change, then frames are encoded at target fps speed for 200 ms. The const frame rate is "application agnostic", so if the application generates less frames per second, (i.e. 15 fps) the encoding frame rate is still maintained at target fps speed (i.e. 60 fps). This setting can be used in those UDP transmissions where the frame rate cannot be irregular. If enabled, quic-persistent-frames has no effect and const fps is used instead.

key.name: quic-adapt-fps-to-bitrate
key.summary: Adapt the framerate to the network conditions in order to save image quality
key.description: Specifies whether to reduce the framerate to reach the bitrate instead of reducing quality. If enabled, the framerate is decreased when the GCC (or target) bitrate is under a min threshold in bps calculated by the encoder with the screen area and the target fps, while the new fps is calculated as target_fps * min_threshold / target_bitrate. The min threshold is calculated by the encoder to reach the best quality with the selected codec. For instance, the min threshold with nvenc at 60 fps in Full HD is (1920 * 1080 / 25) * 60 = 4.97 Mbps. It can be used along constant-framerate: in this case, the framerate is still "constant" (application agnostic) but reduced when the bitrate is under the min threshold.

key.name: target-fps
key.summary: Target frames per second
key.description: Specifies the maximum allowed frames per second. A value of 0 means no limit. A value of -1 means that the target-fps value will be determined according to the server characteristics and the session type. With versions < 2020.2, the -1 value is not recognized and the default value is 25.

key.name: tcp-persistent-frames
key.summary: Default number of persistent video frames to update static regions with TCP/WS connection
key.description: Sets the number of persistent frames to define image quality even if the image content doesn't change between frames. Static areas are encoded multiple times to let the h.264 stream define the image quality over time. This can be done with TCP/WS to reduce the differencies in image quality between h.264 and lossless QUs. Note that high values of persistent frames may shadow actual QUs.

key.name: use-grabber-dirty-region
key.summary: Whether to use dirty regions
key.description: Specifies whether to use dirty screen regions. If enabled, the grabber tries to compute new frames out of the dirty regions from the screen.

key.name: web-client-max-head-resolution
key.summary: Max head resolution for web client
key.description: Sets the maximum resolution of a display head requestable by a web client. A display head is equivalent to a host monitor. The setting is reloaded at each client layout request. This setting is ignored in case the web client is setting the max resolution explicitly. The max-head-resolution limitations option is applied on top of the max width and height values set by this option. In case the value is set to (0, 0), it is ignored.

key.name: window-tracker-process-blacklist
key.summary: Processes to ignore from window tracking
key.description: Deprecated: use 'window-tracker-process-denylist'.

key.name: window-tracker-process-denylist
key.summary: Processes to ignore from window tracking
key.description: Specifies the name of the processes to ignore from window tracking. If the option is not set, DCV does not ignore any processes other than the default deny list of processes defined internally.

key.name: window-tracker-winclass-regex-denylist
key.summary: Window class regexes to ignore from window tracking
key.description: Specifies a list of regexes representing the window class ids to ignore from window tracking.

key.name: gl-displays
key.summary: 3D accelerated X displays
key.description: Specifies the list of local 3D accelerated X displays and screens used by DCV for OpenGL rendering in virtual sessions. If this value is missing, you can't run OpenGL applications in virtual sessions. This setting is ignored for console sessions.

key.name: output-refresh-rate
key.summary: CRTC output refresh rate
key.description: Sets the CRTC output refresh rate. A value of 0 means the default value will be used. Normally this value will be 60HZ. By setting this value the compositor will refresh the screen at the rate specified, which for the case of gnome-shell can mean that it would change the FPS at which it draws on screen.

key.name: skip-dirty-region-vendors
key.summary: Whether to skip dirty regions if the specified vendors are found
key.description: If one of the specified GPU vendors is found on the system the dirty regions will be disabled to avoid known problems with XDamage. If the option is not set, DCV will not probe the GPU vendors.

key.name: use-glx-fallback-provider
key.summary: Whether to use the GLX fallback provider
key.description: Enables the use of the custom GLX provider from Xdcv, which has the hardcoded fbconfigs required by DCV-GL.

key.name: use-shm-pixmaps
key.summary: Whether to use shared memory pixmaps if supported
key.description: If pixmaps is supported by the X server, uses shared memory pixmaps to grab the screen.

key.name: debug-macroblock-propagation
key.summary: Check the updated macroblock map (only for debugging purposes)
key.description: (libx264 encoder only). Check whether libx264 actually complied with the requested P_SKIP hints or not. This a performance impact, enable it only for DEBUGGING purposes.

key.name: enable-macroblock-propagation
key.summary: Enable passing the diffmap data to the libx264 encoder
key.description: (libx264 encoder only). Enables passing the information about which macroblocks have changed according to the diffmap down to libx264 to generate P_SKIP macroblocks accordingly.

key.name: preset
key.summary: libx264 encoder preset (when available)
key.description: Sets the encoding preset.

key.name: threads
key.summary: Thread count
key.description: Sets the thread count. A value of 0 means automatic setting chosen by x264 depending on the core availability. This setting is experimental and might be removed in the future.

key.name: x264opts
key.summary: libx264 options
key.description: Sets the encoding options of libx264 library for both the FFMPEG and the libx264 encoders. Example value: {'cabac':'0', 'trellis':'0'}

key.name: disable-metadata-service-token
key.summary: Disable instance metadata service token
key.description: Disables the instance metadata service token. This is used in order to use the V2 of the instance metadata.

key.name: instance-metadata-mode
key.summary: Use EC2 instance metadata mode
key.description: Uses Amazon EC2 instance metadata mode to generate the instance ID to be used in the metrics. The possible values are: 'ignore' to not connect to the instance metadata, 'use' to always try to connect to the instance metadata, and 'auto' to autodetect if it is under an Amazon EC2 instance and then connect to the instance metadata.

key.name: use-rlm-licensing
key.summary: Use RLM licensing on EC2
key.description: Disables the automatic licensing granted when using an Amazon EC2 instance.

key.name: storage-root
key.summary: Path to file storage root folder
key.description: Specifies a path to the folder to be used as the root folder for file storage operations. If the storage-root is empty or the folder does not exist, the file storage is disabled. Deprecated: use 'storage-root' of section 'session-management/automatic-console-session'.

key.name: autorepeat-mode
key.summary: Behaviour of autorepeat on Linux
key.description: Specifies the behaviour of autorepeat on Linux. Possible values: 'always-on' (delay the keyup for every key in every condition), 'sync-only' (enable autorepeat only for the key combinations where the client and server keyboard layouts matches), or 'disabled' (disable autorepeat).

key.name: enable-autorepeat
key.summary: Whether to allow autorepeat on Linux
key.description: Specifies whether to allow autorepeat for a single key.

key.name: enable-gamepad
key.summary: Whether to allow gamepad input
key.description: Specifies whether gamepad is enabled.

key.name: enable-rdp-scancodes
key.summary: Whether to allow scan codes for RDP proxy
key.description: Enable keyboard scan codes for RDP proxy. It works only with US keyboard on RDP server.

key.name: enable-relative-mouse
key.summary: Whether to allow relative mouse movements
key.description: Specifies whether to allow relative mouse movements.

key.name: enable-stylus
key.summary: Whether to allow stylus input
key.description: Specifies whether a stylus is enabled.

key.name: enable-touch
key.summary: Whether to allow touch input
key.description: Specifies whether touch is enabled.

key.name: mouse-pacing-interval
key.summary: The pacing for mouse move events injection on Windows
key.description: Specifies the interval in millisecond at which the mouse move events are injected. This feature is currently implemented only on Windows. If multiple events are present in an interval, only the most recent one is injected. A 0 value disables the feature and all mouse events are injected as soon as they are received by the server.

key.name: mouse-wheel-sensitivity
key.summary: Sensitivity threshold for mouse wheel on Linux
key.description: Specifies the sensitivity of mouse wheel scrolling on Linux. An higher value means a slower scroll.

key.name: sync-lock-keys
key.summary: Whether to sync lock keys
key.description: Specifies whether to sync lock keys with the client. Possible values: "disabled", "pressed-lock-key", "all-keys".

key.name: license-file
key.summary: License
key.description: Specifies the licenses to use for DCV server when running on non-EC2 instances. Licensing is granted through RLM licenses. It can contain a list of license specifications, separated by ';' on Windows, and separated by ':' on Linux. Each license specification can be a local license file for extended evaluation licenses, or an RLM server port and hostname specified in the format PORT@HOSTNAME for floating licenses. In case multiple licenses are specified, the server will try each one in turn until the first one is validated (e.g. the license file is correctly recognized or the remote RLM server could be contacted). If no value is specified, the server will look for the default license file '/usr/share/license/license.lic' on Linux, 'C:\Program Files\NICE\DCV\Server\license\license.lic' on Windows; in case the default license file is not found, a demo license is used. This parameter is ignored on EC2 instances.

key.name: directory
key.summary: Log output directory
key.description: Specifies the destination to which logs are saved. If not specified it defaults to "C:\ProgramData\NICE\DCV\log\" on Windows and to "/var/log/dcv/" on Linux.

key.name: enable-image-audit
key.summary: Enables content auditing of transferred images
key.description: Specifies if the content of any transferred images has to be saved in a separate file. The images will be stored in a log subdirectory and the filename will be reported in the audit CSV file. If transfer-audit is disabled, the value is ignored.

key.name: level
key.summary: Log level
key.description: Specifies the log file verbosity level. The verbosity levels (in order of the amount of detail they provide) are: 'error', 'warn', 'info', and 'debug'. The new value is effective as soon as it is changed on the configuration and propagated to the DCV agent processes. With versions <= 2019.1, the log level on the DCV agent processes is only set when they start.

key.name: max-file-size
key.summary: Maximum log file size in MegaBytes before rotation
key.description: Specifies the maximum log file size before a rotation is triggered. If the value is '0', rotation by size is disabled, and instead files are rotated when the process generating them is restared.

key.name: rotate
key.summary: Number of log file rotations
key.description: Specifies the number of times that log files are rotated before being removed. If the value is 0, old versions are removed rather than rotated.

key.name: rotation-interval
key.summary: The maximum time interval between two successive log file rotations
key.description: Specifies the maximum time interval between two successive log file rotations. If the value is 'none', files are not rotate based on time. Other possible values are 'every-minute', 'every-twenty-minutes', 'every-hour' and 'every-day'.

key.name: rotation-suffix
key.summary: The suffix to be appended to a rotated log file
key.description: Specifies the suffix to be appended to the rotated log file. In case 'counter' is specified, a simple increasing counter suffix is appended to each rotated log file. In case 'timestamp' is specified, a timestamp of the form 'YYYY-MM-DD-HH-MM' is applied to the log file. In case a rotated file with that timestamp already exists in the log folder, an additional numeric counter is appended to the timestamp.

key.name: show-window-tracker-details
key.summary: Show additional debug details about tracked windows
key.description: Shows additional debug details about tracked windows like: window class id, process name, and window name.

key.name: transfer-audit
key.summary: Transfer direction to audit
key.description: Specifies which transfer direction to audit. If this parameter is enabled, a new CSV file logs transfers between the server and clients. The allowed values are: 'none', 'server-to-client', 'client-to-server', and 'all'. If this value is missing or equal to 'none', transfer audits are disabled and no file is created.

key.name: quic-network-stats-interval
key.summary: Granularity for the QUIC statistics
key.description: The sampling period (in ms) for QUIC-related statistics, GCC controller statistics, including network state transitions, packet groups received, average packet group size, and network delay. Default value: 60000 (60 s).

key.name: reporters
key.summary: Metrics reporters
key.description: Specifies the name of the metrics reporters to use. The current values include: 'carbon', 'console', 'logfile' and 'jsonlogfile'. If this value is missing, metrics are not reported.

key.name: enable-performance-counters
key.summary: Publish performance counters on Windows
key.description: Enables publishing DCV metrics as performance counters.

key.name: prefix
key.summary: Carbon metrics prefix
key.description: Specifies the prefix assigned to each carbon server metric.

key.name: server-address
key.summary: Carbon server address
key.description: Specifies the carbon server address.

key.name: server-port
key.summary: Carbon server port
key.description: Specifies the carbon server TCP port.

key.name: max-reports
key.summary: Maximum number of reports written before file rotation
key.description: Specifies the maximum number of reports written in the json log file before rotation. If the value is 0, no file rotation will be performed.

key.name: client-time-thresholds
key.summary: Thresholds of the client processing time quality indicator
key.description: Specifies the thresholds of the client processing time quality indicator (in milliseconds). The first number is the warning threshold, while the second is the critical threshold.

key.name: display-latency-thresholds
key.summary: Thresholds of the display latency quality indicator
key.description: Specifies the thresholds for the display latency quality indicator (in milliseconds). The first number is the warning threshold, while the second is the critical threshold.

key.name: frame-loss-thresholds
key.summary: Thresholds of the frame loss quality indicator
key.description: Specifies the thresholds of the frame loss quality indicator (as percentages). The first number is the warning threshold, while the second is the critical threshold.

key.name: connection-timeout
key.summary: RDP connection timeout
key.description: Specifies the amount of time (in seconds) to activate the RDP connection. If missing or zero the FreeRDP default value of 9 seconds will be used.

key.name: default-resolution
key.summary: Default resolution
key.description: Specifies the initial default resoultion used when the first connection has been established.

key.name: freerdp-settings
key.summary: Override FreeRDP settings
key.description: Replaces the default values of FreeRDP client settings using the provided values. Example value: {'PAR1':1, 'PAR2':0, 'PAR3':9}

key.name: file-printer-name
key.summary: Name of the virtual DCV Printer for file download
key.description:
String representing the name of the virtual DCV Printer on a DCV server.
In Linux, this value is read from the configuration every time a new Linux DCV session is created. If this setting is non-empty, and has string PREFIX as value, a new virtual printer with name 'PREFIX - SESSION-NUMBER' will be registered in CUPS. If this setting is empty, no DCV virtual printer will be registered.
In Windows, this setting is used to change the default printer on the system. If set to an empty string, DCV will not change the current default printer.

key.name: use-default-printer
key.summary: Decides how the default printer gets set
key.description: Server decides which printer to set as default printer. Accepted values are 'client-decides', 'always-on', 'always-off'. If the value for this setting is 'always-off', the server does not set any printer as default. If the value is 'always-on', sets the printer that is specified in the setting 'file-printer-name' under section 'printer'. If the value is 'client-decides', the default printer sent from the client is set. If no default printer is sent by the client, the printer specified in 'file-printer-name' under section 'printer' is set. The default value is 'client-decides'. Currently supported only on windows.

key.name: allow-multiple-clients
key.summary: Whether to allow multiple clients to use redirection on the same session
key.description: Allows or denies multiple clients to concurrently use the redirection feature on the same session. The default value is 'false' and then the redirection feature can be used only by one client at the time.

key.name: blacklisted-drive-letters
key.summary: Bitmask representing the denied disk drive letters
key.description: Deprecated: use 'drive-letters-denylist'.

key.name: drive-letters-denylist
key.summary: Bitmask representing the denied disk drive letters
key.description: Sets the bitmask representing the disk drive letters that can not be used on drive mount. Bit position 0 (the least-significant bit) is drive A, bit position 1 is drive B, bit position 2 is drive C, and so on. The default value is 0 and then all drive letters are available. This value is read from the configuration every time a drive is mounted.

key.name: enable-file-cache
key.summary: Enable the caching on filesystem operations
key.description: Enables the caching on filesystem operations to improve performance.

key.name: enable-printer-redirection
key.summary: Enable the printer redirection functionality
key.description: Enables the printer redirection functionality on server side. When set to false, all printer redirection requests coming from clients are ignored.

key.name: enable-timezone-redirection
key.summary: Allow or deny time zone redirection from client to server
key.description: Allows or denies time zone to be redirected from client to server. Accepted values are: 'always-on', 'always-off' and 'client-decides'. If it is set to 'always-on', priority user client will send its time zone to the server and that becomes the time zone of the server. If it is set to 'always-off', the server will display its own time zone to the clients. Any client time zone message will be discarded. If it is set to 'client-decides', priority user client can send its time zone to the server and that becomes the time zone of the server. The client can choose not to send its time zone to the server. The default value is 'client-decides'.

key.name: restore-timezone-on-disconnection
key.summary: Restore timezone on server automatically on disconnection
key.description: When this setting is enabled and timezone has been redirected on the server, the latter will be restored to the original when the number of active connections drops to zero. The timezone original value is the one retrieved on the server before a client changes it for the first time with redirection. Please note, the timezone will be restored on client's will (when it turns the redirection off) regardless of this setting.

key.name: redirected-printer-name-suffix
key.summary: Suffix for redirected printer names
key.description: Sets a string which represents the suffix that is added to the name of redirected printers on the DCV server. This value is read from the configuration every time the server receives a printer configuration update (e.g., a new local printer is added). This suffix is appended in the form 'PRINTER_NAME - SUFFIX'. An empty suffix is not accepted and is replaced by the default value.

key.name: administrators
key.summary: Users that can control DCV through the cli and RPC API
key.description: Users in this list can control all DCV sessions and connections. In particular, they can create console sessions, create virtual sessions with another user as username, and list all current sessions independently of their username. This setting is available only on Linux, and it is read on every new RPC connection.

key.name: allowed-http-host-regex
key.summary: Allowed host regular expression
key.description: Specifies a regular expression pattern representing the host names that this DCV server can serve. If the Host header of an incoming HTTP request does not match this pattern, the request itself fails with a 403 Forbidden status code. This is a security measure to prevent HTTP Host header attacks. The pattern must be a valid Javascript-like regular expression. Letters in the pattern match both uppercase and lowercase letters. Example: '^(www\.)?example\.com$'.

key.name: allowed-ws-origin-regex
key.summary: Allowed origins
key.description: Specifies a regular expression pattern representing the origins that this DCV server accepts. When establishing a WebSocket connection, the Origin header field in the client's handshake indicates the origin of the script establishing the connection. If the Origin header of an incoming HTTP request does not match this pattern, the request itself fails with a 403 Forbidden status code. This is a security measure to prevent cross-site WebSocket hijacking (CSWSH) attacks. The pattern must be a valid Javascript-like regular expression. Letters in the pattern match both uppercase and lowercase letters. The Origin header has the form: <scheme> "://" <host> [ ":" <port> ]. Example: '^https://(www\.)?example\.com(:443)?$'.

key.name: auth-connection-setup-timeout
key.summary: Authentication channel connection setup timeout
key.description: Specifies the amount of time (in seconds) allowed for the authentication channel connection setup procedure to be completed before timing out. If the procedure takes more, then the channel is closed. If set to 0, the authentication channel connection setup timeout is disabled.

key.name: auth-token-verifier
key.summary: The endpoint of the authentication token verifier
key.description: Specifies the endpoint (URL) of the authentication token verifier used by the DCV server. If empty, the internal authentication token verifier is used.

key.name: auth-token-verifier-timeout
key.summary: The timeout (in seconds) for the authentication token verifier.
key.description: Specifies the time (in seconds) to wait for the authentication token verifier used by the DCV server.

key.name: auth-token-ttl
key.summary: Expiration time for auth tokens
key.description: Sets the expiration time in seconds for auth tokens obtained from the internal authenticator. If set to 0, auth tokens never expire.

key.name: authentication
key.summary: Authentication method
key.description: Specifies the client authentication method used by the DCV server. Use 'system' to delegate client authentication to the underlying operating system. Use 'none' to disable client authentication and grant access to all clients.

key.name: authentication-threshold
key.summary: Authentication threshold
key.description: Specifies how many times each client can fail authentication before the connection is closed by the server. To allow unlimited authentication attempts, use 0.

key.name: backend-authentication
key.summary: Backend authentication methods
key.description: Specifies the set of methods used by the DCV server to authenticate the agent connection. Allowed values are: 'user' to check the active user of a console sesison of the running user of a virtual session; 'path' to check the real path of the agent process. Use an empty list, or 'none' to disable the authentication. Default value ['user', 'path'].

key.name: backend-authentication-timeout
key.summary: The timeout in milliseconds for requests to the session launcher
key.description: Sets the period (in milliseconds) to wait before the dbus connection times out for requests to the session launcher (for agent authentication).

key.name: ca-file
key.summary: CA file
key.description: Specifies the file containing the certificate authorities (CAs) trusted by the DCV server. If empty, use the default trust store provided by the system.

key.name: certificate-to-user-file
key.summary: Certificate to user mapping file
key.description: Specifies the file containing the certificate to user mapping list.

key.name: ciphers
key.summary: Cipher list used on the TLS connections
key.description: Specifies the cipher list used on TLS connections. The cipher list must be separated using the character ":" and must be supported by openssl and the clients.

key.name: connection-estab-timeout
key.summary: Connection establishment timeout
key.description: Specifies the amount of time (in seconds) allowed for the connection procedure to be completed before timing out. If the procedure takes more, then the connection is closed. If set to 0, the connection establishment does not time out.

key.name: connection-setup-timeout
key.summary: Channel connection setup timeout
key.description: Specifies the amount of time (in seconds) allowed for the channel connection setup procedure to be completed before timing out. If the procedure takes more, then the channel is closed. If set to 0, the channel connection setup does not time out.

key.name: connection-throttler-parameters
key.summary: Connection throttler configuration parameters
key.description: Sets parameters for the token bucket throttling algorithm as (Size, Rate). Size is the size of the bucket. Rate is the rate at which the bucket is filled in items per second.

key.name: crl-file
key.summary: CRL file
key.description: Specifies the file containing the certificate revocation list (CRL).

key.name: enable-authentication-throttler
key.summary: Whether to enable the authentication throttler
key.description: If enabled, the user account will be temporary locked after certain number of consecutive failed login attempts and it will not be able to login in the server.

key.name: enable-ovirt-sso
key.summary: Whether to own the org.ovirt.vdsm.Credentials D-Bus name for SSO
key.description: If enabled, the server will own the org.ovirt.vdsm.Credentials D-Bus name in order to enable SSO with GNOME Shell without our extension. Enabling this configuration is not enough for SSO, the user has to manually create a /etc/pam.d/gdm-ovirtcred symlink that points to /etc/pam.d/dcv-graphical-sso.

key.name: enable-gssapi
key.summary: Enable GSSAPI SASL mechanism
key.description: Enables or disables GSSAPI SASL mechanism, that allows DCV authentication with kerberos.

key.name: encryption
key.summary: Encryption mode
key.description: Enables or disables the encryption of data exchanged between the server and the client. Valid values include: prefer-on, 'prefer-off', and 'always-on'. If prefer-on, encryption is enabled unless it is specifically disabled by the client. If prefer-off, encryption is disabled unless it is enforced by the client. If always-on, encryption is enabled regardless of the clients settings.

key.name: max-connections-per-user
key.summary: Maximum number of user's connections
key.description: Specifies the maximum number of allowed concurrent connections per user. Exceeding connections are rejected.

key.name: max-rpc-per-user
key.summary: Maximum number of rpc user's connections
key.description: Specifies the maximum number of allowed concurrent connections per user for RPC. Exceeding connections are rejected. If set to 0, all connections are allowed.

key.name: no-tls-strict
key.summary: Enable or disable strict certificate validation
key.description: Enables or disables strict certificate validation when connecting to an external authentication token verifier. Strict certificate validation must be disabled if the authentication token verifier uses a self-signed certificate.

key.name: os-auto-lock
key.summary: Whether to lock the OS session when last client connection ends
key.description: If enabled, the OS session is locked when the last client connection is closed.

key.name: pam-service-name
key.summary: PAM service name
key.description: Specifies the name of the PAM configuration file used by DCV. The default PAM service name is 'dcv' and corresponds with the /etc/pam.d/dcv configuration file. This parameter is only used if the 'system' authentication method is used.

key.name: pam-timeout
key.summary: PAM timeout
key.description: Specifies the amount of time (in seconds) before DCV aborts the conversation with PAM to verify the user's credentials.

key.name: passwd-file
key.summary: Password file
key.description: Specifies the password file to be used to check user credentials (only with dcv authentication mode). If empty, use the default file in ${XDG_CONFIG_HOME}/NICE/dcv/passwd for Linux, or %CSIDL_LOCAL_APPDATA%\NICE\dcv\passwd for Windows.

key.name: rpc-throttler-parameters
key.summary: RPC throttler configuration parameters
key.description: Sets the parameters for the token bucket throttling algorithm as (Size, Rate). Size is the size of the bucket. Rate is the rate at which the bucket is filled in items per second.

key.name: service-name
key.summary: Service Name
key.description: The registered name of the service (usually the protocol name).

key.name: server-fqdn
key.summary: Server FQDN
key.description: Specifies the server fully qualified domain name. Empty means gethostname().

key.name: supervision-control
key.summary: The type of supervision control for the sessions
key.description: Specifies the type of supervision control for the sessions. The possible values are 'disabled' and 'enforced'. If this value is set to 'enforced', then unsupervised-access permission can be set to allow or deny owner-less access of users in a collaborative session. If unsupervised-access is allowed for a user, the user can access a session without an owner. All users except the owner are denied this permission by default. When this value is set to 'disabled' (default), the server does not enforce this supervision control and permission. The new value is effective as soon as it is changed in the configuration.

key.name: throttler-established-timeout
key.summary: Throttler established timeout
key.description: Specifies the amount of time (in seconds) before the transport is closed, between the service connection and when the peer provides the id to be used by the throttler.

key.name: user-realm
key.summary: Server user realm
key.description: Specifies a user realm for the server.

key.name: agent-env-vars
key.summary: Additional env vars to be propagated to agent process
key.description: Specifies the list of additional environment variables to be used for agent launching. The setting is used by the Linux system agent process launched with the run-user strategy. By default no additional env var is used. Example value: {'ENV1':'1', ''ENV2':'2'}

key.name: agent-launch-strategy
key.summary: Specify the strategy used to launch the agent in console sessions
key.description: Specifies whether to use the xdg-autostart or the legacy strategy to trigger the agent launch in console sessions. Allowed values: 'xdg-autostart', 'run-user'. Default value 'xdg-autostart' on RHEL8, Sles15 and Ubuntu20, 'run-user' on other distributions.

key.name: create-session
key.summary: Create a console session at server startup
key.description: Specifies whether to automatically create a console session (with ID "console") at server startup.

key.name: enable-gl-in-virtual-sessions
key.summary: Whether to employ dcv-gl feature
key.description: Specifies whether to use the dcv-gl feature (a license is required). Allowed values: 'always-on', 'always-off', 'default-on', 'default-off'.

key.name: force-agent-exit
key.summary: Whether to force agent termination or wait for resources to be disposed
key.description: Specifies whether to force the agent termination with TerminateProcess or exit or wait for resources to be disposed

key.name: login-monitor-poll-interval
key.summary: The interval in seconds to periodically check the loginn monitor state
key.description: Specifies the interval (in seconds) after which the login monitor state has to be verified. If set to 0, the loginmonitor will be updated only when a system event has been detected.

key.name: max-concurrent-sessions
key.summary: Maximum number of concurrent sessions
key.description: Specifies the maximum number of allowed concurrent sessions. This limit currently applies only to virtual sessions, because console sessions are intrinsically limited to one. Specify 0 to not enforce any limit.

key.name: max-sessions-per-user
key.summary: Maximum number of sessions per user
key.description: Specifies the maximum number of allowed concurrent sessions that each user can own. This limit currently applies only to virtual sessions. Specify 0 to not enforce any limit.

key.name: max-concurrent-clients
key.summary: Maximum number of concurrent clients per session
key.description: Specifies the maximum number of concurrent clients per session. If set to -1, no limit is enforced. To set the limit only for the automatic session, use 'max-concurrent-clients' of section 'session-management/automatic-console-session'.

key.name: owner
key.summary: Owner of the automatically created "console" session
key.description: Specifies the user name of the "console" session owner. If empty, the owner is the user who started the DCV server. This setting is applied only to the "console" session automatically created at server startup when the create-session setting is set to true. Deprecated: use 'owner' of section 'session-management/automatic-console-session'.

key.name: permissions-file
key.summary: Permissions file for the automatically created "console" session
key.description: Specifies the path of the permissions file to be used to check user access to DCV features. If empty, only the owner has full access to the session. Such permissions file applies only to the "console" session automatically created at server startup when the create-session setting is set to true. Deprecated: use 'permissions-file' of section 'session-management/automatic-console-session'.

key.name: virtual-session-default-layout
key.summary: Default layout for virtual sessions
key.description: If this is set, Xdcv is configured to create the specified layout at startup. Each monitor can be configured with resolution (w,h) and position (x,y). All specified monitors are enabled. Default layout example value: [{'w':<800>, 'h':<600>, 'x':<0>, 'y': <0>}, {'w':<1024>, 'h':<768>, 'x':<800>, 'y':<0>}] For this setting, the maximum number of monitors (specified in the virtual-session-monitors setting) has more priority than the number of elements in the array. For example, if five monitors have been set, but the maximum number of monitors is four, only the first four monitors are created. If this key is set, the number of enabled monitors (specified in the virtual-session-monitors setting) is ignored.

key.name: virtual-session-font-path
key.summary: Whether to add special font paths
key.description: Specifies the path of special fonts. Some applications require a special font to be passed to the X server.

key.name: virtual-session-monitors
key.summary: Number of monitors configuration on virtual sessions
key.description: Sets the monitor configuration for virtual sessions (max number of monitors, number of enabled monitors).

key.name: virtual-session-source-profile
key.summary: Whether to source the user profile in session starter
key.description: Specifies whether the shell that runs the session starter script should source the user profile. By default this is false and DCV will run the session starter script with "bash --noprofile --norc"

key.name: virtual-session-start-timeout
key.summary: The timeout in milliseconds to start a virtual session
key.description: Sets the period (in milliseconds) to wait before the dbus connection times out while attempting to start a virtual session. Default value 30000 (30 seconds).

key.name: virtual-session-xdcv-args
key.summary: Additional arguments to pass to Xdcv
key.description: Specifies any additional arguments to be passed to Xdcv.

key.name: client-eviction-policy
key.summary: Specify how to handle client connections when a limit is reached
key.description: Specifies whether to reject a new connection or to automatically close an existing connection when the maximum number of concurrent clients per session is reached. Allowed values are 'reject-new-connection' (the incoming connection will be closed), and 'same-user-oldest-connection' (the server will close the connection of the same user that hasn't interacted with the session for the longest time or, absent that information, with the oldest connection time).

key.name: max-concurrent-clients
key.summary: Maximum number of concurrent clients per session
key.description: Specifies the maximum number of concurrent clients allowed per session. If set to -1, no limit is enforced.

key.name: owner
key.summary: Owner of the automatically created "console" session
key.description: Specifies the username of the "console" session owner. If empty, the owner is the user who started the DCV server. This setting is applied only to the "console" session automatically created at server startup when the create-session setting is set to true.

key.name: permissions-file
key.summary: Permissions file for the automatic "console" session
key.description: Specifies the path to the permissions file to be used to check user access to DCV features. If empty, only the owner has full access to the session.

key.name: storage-root
key.summary: Path to file storage root folder
key.description: Specifies the full path to the folder to be used for console session storage. If the storage-root is empty or the folder does not exist, file storage is disabled.

key.name: permissions-file
key.summary: Default permissions included in all sessions
key.description: Specifies the path to the permissions file to be automatically merged with the permissions selected by the user for each session. If empty, use the 'default.perm' file, which is located in /etc/dcv/ for Linux, or in the DCV installation folder (for example, 'C:\Program Files\NICE\DCV\Server\conf') for Windows.

key.name: enable-cache
key.summary: Whether to enable smartcard caching messages
key.description: Enables or disables smart card caching. When enabled, the NICE DCV server caches the last value received from the client's smart card. Future calls are retrieved directly from the server's cache, instead of from client. This helps to reduce the amount of traffic that is transferred between the client and the server, and improves performance. Allowed values include 'always-on', 'always-off', 'default-on', and 'default-off'. This value is read from the configuration every time a client smartcard application is started.

key.name: library-injection
key.summary: The library injection strategy applied for smartcard.
key.description: Specifies whether the library injection should be performed by the server or not when running on Windows. Allowed values include 'auto' (server will enable the injection if the smartcard filter driver is not installed), 'enabled' (injection performed in any case), 'disabled' (injection disabled in any case). This value is read from the configuration every time smartcard service is activated.

key.name: codecs
key.summary: List of codecs for webcam streaming
key.description: The list of available encoding codecs for the webcam streaming. They are sorted by preference.

key.name: enabled-sessions
key.summary: Whether to enable webcam injection for the different session types
key.description: Specifies whether to enable webcam for the different session types for the linux server. The possible values are 'none', 'console', 'virtual' and 'all' to enable both types Linux session. The default value is 'none'.

key.name: max-bitrate
key.summary: Max webcam bitrate in kbps
key.description: Specifies the maximum allowed bitrate of the video coded. If this value is missing no constrain will be used.

key.name: max-resolution
key.summary: Max webcam resolution
key.description: Specifies the maximum webcam resolution that is exposed to applications.

key.name: monitor-method
key.summary: The method used to monitor webcam usage in Linux.
key.description: Specifies the method used to determine if the AWS virtual webcam is being used by an application. Allowed values are 'inotify' (the default) and 'disabled' (disable usage monitoring). Usage monitoring allows the DCV client to start streaming only when an application accesses the camera; if monitoring is disabled, the connected client's webcam will be turned on as soon as the user enables the webcam toolbar icon.

key.name: preferred-resolution
key.summary: The preferred webcam resolution
key.description: Specifies the preferred webcam resolution among the resolutions provided by the client. If the specified resolution is not supported, the closest matching resolution is selected and exposed to applications. If one of the values specified is 0, webcam sharing is disabled.

key.name: webcam-sync-interval
key.summary: Number of milliseconds over which the average audio delay is estimated
key.description: Sets the size of the time window used to calculate the average delay to be applied to webcam frames in order to force synchronization. Set to 0 to use latest audio latency.

key.name: webcam-sync-max-delay
key.summary: Maximum number of milliseconds for the webcam sync delay
key.description: Any positive value enables synchronization of webcam frames with audio coming from the microphone. This sets the maximum number of milliseconds the webcam stream can be delayed to wait for the audio stream. Set to 0 to disable webcam sync.

key.name: agent-priority-class
key.summary: Priority class of the agent
key.description: Sets the Windows priority class of the agent processes, one of 'idle', 'below-normal', 'normal', 'above-normal', 'high', or 'realtime'. The setting is read at every agent launch.

key.name: disable-display-sleep
key.summary: Prevent display from entering power-saving mode
key.description: Specifies whether to prevent the display from entering power-saving mode.

key.name: disable-drag-full-windows
key.summary: Set the DRAGFULLWINDOWS Windows option
key.description: Sets the DRAGFULLWINDOWS Windows option. Set it to false so that dragging windows is more lightweight.

key.name: disable-dwm-composition
key.summary: Turn off DWM
key.description: Enables or disables the Windows Desktop Window Manager (DWM). This value is ignored in Windows 8 and later.

key.name: disable-windows-animation
key.summary: Set the SETANIMATION Windows option
key.description: Sets the SETANIMATION Windows option. Set it to false so that the user interface is more lightweight.

key.name: enable-iocp
key.summary: Enable I/O completion port for asynchronous I/O
key.description: Allows to use the I/O completion port for asynchronous I/O instead of the polling approach in the communication between server and agent.

key.name: enable-simulate-sas
key.summary: Enable support for SAS simulation
key.description: Enables clients to send the Secure Attention Sequence (SAS, the Ctrl+Alt+Del key combination) to a DCV server computer running Windows. To be able to simulate SAS on the server computer, the local security policy of the computer must also be configured to allow services to simulate an SAS.

key.name: printer
key.summary: Printer to be set as default
key.description: Specifies the name of the virtual DCV printer. The name is used to change the default printer on the system. If set to an empty string, DCV will not change the current default printer. Deprecated: use 'file-printer-name' of section 'printer'.

key.name: usb-allowlist-file
key.summary: Allowlist file for the permitted USB devices
key.description: Specifies the path to the allowlist file containing the USB devices that can be remotized. If empty, the path defaults to the 'usb-devices.conf' file, which is located in /etc/dcv/ for Linux, and the DCV installation folder (for example, 'C:\Program Files\NICE\DCV\Server\conf') for Windows.

key.name: usb-whitelist-file
key.summary: Allowlist file for the permitted USB devices
key.description: Deprecated: use 'usb-allowlist-file'.

key.name: enabled
key.summary: Whether the extensions feature should be enabled
key.description: Specifies if the extensions feature is enabled. If the extensions feature is disabled, users will not be able to use third party extensions for DCV.

key.name: load-policy
key.summary: Determines if extensions are checked for digital signatures or not.
key.description: The valid values are 'all' or 'only-signed' (default='only-signed'). If 'all' is specified, extensions will be loaded without checking if the executable contains a valid digital signature. If 'only-signed' is specified, extensions will only be loaded if their executable contains a valid digital signature.

key.name: enabled
key.summary: Whether the webauthn redirection feature should be enabled
key.description: This setting controls the redirection of WebAuthn requests. When enabled, it allows users to authenticate for web resources using their local authenticator, such as YubiKey, Windows Hello, or others. If you disable this setting, WebAuthn redirection will be disabled, and users won't be able to use their local authenticators.
